column4: hey I just downloaded an adobe reader binary...where do I put the binary so that it will be available system wide?  /usr/bin/ ?
anywhere you want
but I know it's not available system wide though right now
what do you mean "available system wide"
well I think I have to place it in /usr/bin/  to make sure that it is available @ the command prompt right?
echo $PATH - anything in those directories you can invoke by just typing the command
I'm trying to open a pdf from the command line w/ the Adobe Reader binary file...it won't work...how would you go about doing it?  AdobeReader.bin ~/Downloads/book.pdf ?
I don't think you can pass AdobeReader.bin arguments
then how would u use the binary then?  I'm confused
run the binary, it opens the gui, then open the document in that gui
or look at the other pdf viewers which are already part of ubuntu
how do you "run the binary" from the command line?
I'd advise you to use one of the packaged built for ubuntu to get the gui as part of your desktop
you will find it much easier
how do you do that?
do you know how to use the ubuntu package manager ?
synaptic ?
that's one of them, if you open the package manager and search for the applications ubottu gave you twice, you can install them
those applications are then part of your desktop experience
adobe isn't in repository
rather than having to load applications from the command line
I know adobe isn't that's why I had ubottu give you links for different pdf readers
I'm just gonn use xpdf
that's a good plan
